workflow.name: Automate payment receipts: Email, archive, and track with Stripe and Google Workspace
workflow.description:
## Description
This workflow automates the process of retrieving Stripe invoices, validating API responses, generating payment receipts, sending them via email, storing PDFs in Google Drive, and appending details to a Google Sheet ledger. It also includes an error logging system to capture and record workflow issues, ensuring financial operations are both automated and reliable.

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
- üìã Manual Trigger ‚Äì Start the workflow manually by clicking Execute workflow.
-  üîó Fetch Invoices ‚Äì Authenticates with Stripe and retrieves the 5 most recent invoices (includes customer info, amounts, statuses, and invoice URLs).
-  ‚úÖ Check API Response ‚Äì Ensures the Stripe API response contains a valid data[] array. If not, errors are logged.
-  üìÇ Expand List ‚Äì Splits Stripe‚Äôs bundled invoice list into individual invoice records for independent processing.
-  üí≥ IF (Paid?) ‚Äì Routes invoices based on payment status; only paid invoices move forward.
-  üìß IF (Already Receipted?) ‚Äì Skips invoices where a receipt has already been generated (receipt_sent = true).
-  üìë Download File ‚Äì Downloads the hosted invoice PDF from Stripe for use in emails and archiving.
-  ‚úâÔ∏è Send Receipt Email ‚Äì Emails the customer a payment receipt with the PDF attached, using invoice details (number, amount, customer name).
-  ‚òÅÔ∏è Upload Invoice PDF ‚Äì Uploads the invoice PDF to a specific Google Drive folder, named by invoice number.
-  üìä Append to Ledger ‚Äì Updates a Google Sheet with invoice metadata (date, invoice number, Drive file ID, link, size).
-  ‚ö†Ô∏è Error Logging ‚Äì Logs workflow issues (failed API calls, missing data, etc.) into a dedicated error tracking sheet.

## Prerequisites
- Stripe API key (with invoice read permissions)
- Google Drive (destination folder for invoices)
- Google Sheets with:
- Receipts Ledger Sheet
- Error Logging Sheet
- Gmail OAuth2 account for sending receipts

## Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Automates customer receipt delivery with attached PDFs
 ‚úÖ Builds a permanent ledger in Google Sheets for finance
 ‚úÖ Archives invoices in Google Drive for easy retrieval
 ‚úÖ Prevents duplicates by checking receipt_sent metadata
 ‚úÖ Includes error logging for smooth monitoring and debugging

## Perfect For
- Finance/accounting teams needing automated receipt handling
- SaaS businesses managing recurring Stripe invoices
- Operations teams requiring error-proof automation
- Any business needing audit-ready receipts + logs

workflow.name: Archive Payment Receipts with Stripe, Google Drive, and Google Sheets

parameters.content:
Fetch Invoices

Description: Makes an authenticated request to the Stripe API and retrieves the 5 most recent invoices. This serves as the raw dataset that contains invoice details such as customer information, amounts, statuses, and hosted invoice URLs.
Action: Fetches invoice data from Stripe.

Send Receipt Email ‚Äì 

Description: Sends an email to the customer using the invoice details (customer name, invoice number, amount, etc.). The previously downloaded invoice PDF is attached automatically. This ensures the customer receives a formal receipt directly in their inbox.
Action: Sends a payment receipt email with the PDF attached.

Download File 

Description: Uses the invoice‚Äôs hosted PDF link (invoice_pdf) to fetch the actual receipt document. It retrieves the PDF from Stripe as binary data, making it usable as an email attachment or for archiving.
Action: Downloads the invoice PDF from Stripe.

IF (Already Receipted?) 

Description: Looks into the invoice metadata field receipt_sent. If the receipt has already been generated and sent, the workflow will skip. Otherwise, it continues to generate and send the receipt email.
Action: Filters out invoices that already have a receipt sent.

IF (Paid?)

Description: Evaluates whether the invoice is marked as status = paid. Only paid invoices should move forward to receipt generation. Unpaid or draft invoices are skipped here.
Action: Routes invoices based on payment status.

Expand List

Description: Since Stripe returns a bundled list of invoices, this node breaks them into individual records. That way, each invoice can be independently evaluated (paid/unpaid, receipted/unreceipted) and processed correctly in subsequent steps.
Action: Splits Stripe‚Äôs invoice list into single invoice items.

Append to Ledger 

Description: Adds a new row in the ‚ÄúPayment Receipts‚Äù Google Sheet ledger with key invoice details such as date, invoice number, file name, Drive link, file ID, and file size. This acts as your permanent record of receipts for accounting and tracking purposes.
Action: Updates the Google Sheet with invoice + Drive file metadata.

Upload Invoice PDF 

Description: Uploads the invoice PDF into a specific Google Drive folder. The file is named according to the invoice number, making it easy to search and retrieve later.
Action: Stores the invoice PDF in Google Drive.

parameters.message:
=Hi {{$json.customer_name}},  

Thanks for your payment.  
Attached is your receipt for invoice {{$json.number}} (Total: {{$json.currency}} {{$json.total}}).  

Regards,  
Your Company
parameters.subject: =Payment Receipt - Invoice {{$json.number}}

parameters.content:
Action: Logs workflow errors and failures to a dedicated error tracking spreadsheet for monitoring and debugging purposes. 

Description: This Google Sheets append node serves as the error logging destination for your workflow's error handling system. When API calls fail, data validation errors occur, or other workflow issues arise, this node captures the error details and appends them as new rows to your "error log sheet".

Action: Validates that the Stripe API returned a proper data array before attempting to process invoices. 

Description: This conditional node acts as a data quality gate that prevents the workflow from breaking when the Stripe API returns unexpected or empty responses. It specifically checks for the existence of the data array in the API response, which is the standard structure that Stripe uses to return collections of objects like invoices, payments, or disputes.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
